SENT.plain: Pseudotumor was diagnosed in six patients aged three to 38 years during an eight year period
The diagnosis was based on headache, choked disks and normal cerebrospinal fluid and CT scans
Other symptoms were visual impairment, VIth nerve palsy and ataxia
Sagital sinus trombosis was excluded by angiography or magnetic resonance imaging
Pharmacological treatment with digitoxin, acetazolamide, furosemide or corticisteroids reversed clinical symptoms and signs in two patients
In the other four, shunt surgery with cerebrospinal fluid diversion to the right atrium or the peritoneal cavity rapidly reversed clinical symptoms and signs
